Reading Bruker OPUS binary files in R

Philipp Baumann

2022-10-29

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

Bruker OPUS is a proprietary file format to store measurement parameters and spectra. The file format is produced by the Bruker OPUS software.

Basic usage 

library("opusreader2")
file <- opus_file()
data_list <- read_opus(file)

read_opus is a list-parser using S3 classes. The data is arranged as shown in the Bruker OPUS viewer:

names(data_list)
#>  [1] "refl_no_atm_comp_data_param"     "refl_no_atm_comp"               
#>  [3] "quant_report_refl"               "sc_sample_data_param"           
#>  [5] "sc_sample"                       "sc_ref_data_param"              
#>  [7] "sc_ref"                          "optics"                         
#>  [9] "optics_ref"                      "acquisition_ref"                
#> [11] "fourier_transformation_ref"      "fourier_transformation"         
#> [13] "sample"                          "acquisition"                    
#> [15] "instrument_ref"                  "instrument"                     
#> [17] "lab_and_process_param_raw"       "lab_and_process_param_processed"
#> [19] "info_block"                      "history"
